resources.string: Visitors of certain social, cultural or athletic activities must take a coronavirus test first. Even if they\'re vaccinated. Visitors only get access when the test proves they do not have coronavirus.
The visitor shows a QR code. This is the valid negative test declaration. With this app, you scan the visitor\'s QR code. The QR code must be scanned within %1$s hours after testing.

Green screen? Ask the visitor to show their proof of identity. Check whether the data on your screen matches the proof of identity. This way, you\'re sure the test result belongs to the visitor and you can give them access.
With this app, you can receive visitors again. But only if your social, cultural or athletic activity falls under the designated locations.
The acceptable use policy details how CoronaCheck Scanner uses your data and what your rights are.
The QR code contains minimal data of the visitor
You\'re only allowed to use this data to check the valid negative test result

The visitor\'s data is
not centrally stored anywhere
I\'ve read and agree to the acceptable use policy.
Sorry, there was a technical error
Now scan the QR codes of your visitors. But please note: you\'re only allowed to give access to visitors with a valid QR code. How scanning works
This is not a valid declaration in the Netherlands. Ask the visitor to show a dutch QR-code.
The visitor doesn\'t have a valid negative test declaration. Read possible causes

This does not mean the visitor has coronavirus. Possible causes
  • The person hasn\'t been tested
  • The QR code has been forwarded
  • The QR code has been forged
What to do now?Ask the visitor to take a test first. Once the test result is known, the visitor can use the CoronaCheck app to turn it into a QR code.

Make sure the QR code belongs to the visitor by checking if the details on your screen correspond with their proof of identity.Note: details may be incomplete
In order to protect the visitor’s privacy, not all data is displayed. Some fields may contain a hyphen (-). It’s sufficient to check the details that are displayed.If the details are incorrect, the visitor is not allowed access.

CoronaCheck Scanner is created so that social, cultural and sports locations can open their doors again. Think for example of events, museums and concerts. With this app, only visitors that are able to prove they’ve recently tested negative for corona can get access. This way, the Netherlands can head out more often.

Press the \'Start Scanning\' button and ask the visitor to show their QR code. They can show their code using the CoronaCheck app or the paper version. The QR code acts as a valid negative test declaration and can be read at a safe distance.
Point your phone camera at the visitor\'s valid negative test declaration. Scan the QR code.
Person is holding a phone with a green screen and a black check mark.

Green screen? The visitor has a valid negative test declaration. Now check whether the data on your screen match the data on the proof of identity. All good? Then the visitor may enter. They might also need an entrance ticket.
Person is holding a phone with a red screen and a black cross.

Red screen? This does not mean the visitor has coronavirus. It just means the QR code is invalid. So there is no proof of a recent negative test result. Here\'s what you can do:
  • Check whether the visitor shows the QR code using the CoronaCheck app. A screenshot or copy of the QR code always results in a red screen.
  • Ask the visitor to completely close the app and open it again. Then scan the QR code again.
  • Do you keep getting a red screen even though the visitor has a negative test result? Direct the visitor to our help desk. Phone number: 0800-1421.
A green screen is always needed for entry. Does the visitor not have a (valid) QR code? Then you cannot let them enter. Find more information here.
Point your device at the QR code on the visitor\'s screen. Or at their paper negative test declaration.
Scanner wants to access your camera
So the app can scan QR codes
The app is no longer in use. For more information, go to CoronaCheck.nl
To continue, download the latest version of the app.
You\'re not connected to the internet
You need to be connected to start the app.

Here\'s what changed
  • Description of acceptable use policy
  • App usage explanation
  • Camera usage permission
Read the full acceptable use policy here.
You can\'t proceed if you don\'t agree
You don\'t have access to the CoronaCheck Scanner app if you don\'t agree to the updated policy.
